comment.body:
Bei diesem Beitrag scheint es sich um einen Post zum Tourismus in Wien zu handeln. Hilfreiche Tipps findest [hier](https://www.reddit.com/r/vienna/wiki/index/tourismus).

This post seems to be a post about tourism in Vienna. Helpful tips can be found [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/vienna/wiki/index/tourism).

*I am a bot, and this action was performed automatically. Please [contact the moderators of this subreddit](/message/compose/?to=/r/vienna) if you have any questions or concerns.*
Try looking for a job in a pub. You normally only find english speaking ppl there.

definitely doable ! a few of the cafés I frequent have english speaking baristas. you should however be able to understand an order in german. oh and btw, r/vienna isn't very active, the locals use r/wien just in case you have any more questions :)

Are you an EU citizen?

Try delivery jobs, warehouse work, dish cleaning, hostels, hotels, concert venues, private tutoring
Any suggestions for non-eu / full time ?

Study in an Austrian university and specialize in a Mangelfach. 

Show international companies with research departments that you would be valuable to their team.

Embassy

Copywriting

I’m actually asking for a family friend who just finished her master in Austria- but is non-eu and it seems to be quite a challenge to get a company willing to arrange a visa. I’ll pass on your advice, thanks!
